title: Trimming the CSS bundle
content:
I cut the CSS bundle by deleting unused selectors and collapsing variations into tokens. No preprocessors just consistent naming and a short list of utility classes I actually use.

The payoff shows up in first paint: fewer bytes over the wire and less render thrash. Debugging also sped up because every selector I see in devtools now maps to something intentional.

Keeping styles small encourages me to design with restraint. Components look related, spacing stays coherent, and the dark/light modes stay in sync.
